channel.title: Prototype
channel.description:
I'll just start off by saying this: this game is absolutely amazing from what I've played of it so far. You are Alex Mercer, a "prototype" who wakes up in a morgue to find he has been gifted with new abilities. With a virus taking over New York City, your objective, as a newly formed mixture of superman and spiderman who remembers nothing, is to find out who did this to you, and make them pay. As an added bonus, you have the ability to shape shift as you use your abilities to fight and sneak past the military to complete your objective.
http://www.gametrailers.com/video/review-prototype/51505
Anyone else played it? (*Tico waits for Thug-life's response)

item.title: Prototype
item.dc:creator: @933pm 933pm
item.description:
@933pm wrote:

PeterMan:

I downloaded it for PC, but so far I find it boring pretty quickly. Can’t stand to play it more than 1 or a half hour at a time.

Same… it’s thrilling for the first hour.

item.title: Prototype
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Tico, post:21, topic:290122”][quote author=Frell link=topic=383508.msg2918609#msg2918609 date=1250624335]
They need to learn to co-op. It sucks.
[/quote]

How exactly would a game that focuses almost directly on one character deal with co-op?[/quote]
I could care less about how it would effect the story line, as long as it had co-op. They could do something where the other play is another prototype who had the same thing done to him. I wouldn’t care, some games that have multilayer have nothing to do with the campaign.

Read full topic

item.title: Prototype
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Elijah:

It gets to be very repetitive for me. I got burned out halfway through the storyline, and the sandbox aspect of it didn’t save the game for me. Of course flying helicopters was OK.

Flying, running fast and having super strength never get boring. But hey, everyone is entitled to their own opinion.

Read full topic

item.title: Prototype
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Awesome game, awesome. It has its flaws, but some things of it are just done so well, like the fact that you’re a dude with like, every superpower known to man, and yet the game is still pretty challenging in places (that is until you’ve played it once, its definitely the sort of game that gets a lot easier once you know what you’re doing properly).

I love how everything flows as well, like if you happen to be mid-frontflip over a car and you go to pick it up, he will grab it as he rolls, I wasn’t expecting that at all, most games would either just not let you grab it or glitch out the animations… I dunno, the whole game just feels very fluid and smooth, all ur motions run into each other well, its like parkour but with more helicoptor karate-kicking

what system did u get it on btw

Read full topic
